title: Ticket #2348: suppression of default RequestMemory requirements is flakey
description:
condor_submit inserts the following default requirements: 

   ( ( RequestMemory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize )

This is problematic, because ImageSize for some jobs is quite a bit larger than the amount of physical RAM the job actually needs.

condor_submit tries to allow the user to override the default requirements. In theory, any explicit reference to RequestMemory overrides the default, but this does not work in all cases. If the user's unparsed requirement expression contains the characters "memory" not preceded by the letter "t" before it refers to RequestMemory, the default requirement is always inserted.

Example that fails to suppress default: 

   TARGET.Memory >= MY.RequestMemory

Example that successfully suppresses default: 

   MY.RequestMemory <= TARGET.Memory
remarks:
2011-Aug-03 15:45:51 by danb:
The deeper issue of sloppy attribute reference detection shall be dealt with in the dev series: see #2350.

2011-Aug-03 16:11:27 by matt:
The approach sure looks better than the old one. 

$ condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.6.1 May 31 2011 BuildID: RH-7.6.1-0.9.el6 $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-Fedora_13 $

$ ./release_dir/bin/condor_version
$CondorVersion: 7.6.3 Aug 03 2011 $
$CondorPlatform: X86_64-Fedora_13 $


$ echo "cmd=/bin/true\nhold=true\nrequirements=RequestMemory =!= UNDEFINED\nqueue" | condor_submit
$ echo "cmd=/bin/true\nhold=true\nrequirements=TARGET.Memory >= MY.RequestMemory\nqueue" | condor_submit
$ echo "cmd=/bin/true\nhold=true\nrequirements=MY.RequestMemory <= TARGET.Memory\nqueue" | condor_submit

$ condor_q -format "%s\n" Requirements
( RequestMemory =!= undefined )       && ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( ( TARGET.Memory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) && ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain )
( TARGET.Memory >= MY.RequestMemory ) && ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( ( RequestMemory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) && ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain )
( MY.RequestMemory <= TARGET.Memory ) && ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain )


$ echo "cmd=/bin/true\nhold=true\nrequirements=RequestMemory =!= UNDEFINED\nqueue" | ./release_dir/bin/condor_submit
$ echo "cmd=/bin/true\nhold=true\nrequirements=TARGET.Memory >= MY.RequestMemory\nqueue" | ./release_dir/bin/condor_submit
$ echo "cmd=/bin/true\nhold=true\nrequirements=MY.RequestMemory <= TARGET.Memory\nqueue" | ./release_dir/bin/condor_submit

$ condor_q -format "%s\n" Requirements
( RequestMemory =!= undefined )       && ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( ( TARGET.Memory * 1024 ) >= ImageSize ) && ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain )
( TARGET.Memory >= MY.RequestMemory ) && ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain )
( MY.RequestMemory <= TARGET.Memory ) && ( TARGET.Arch == "X86_64" ) && ( TARGET.OpSys == "LINUX" ) && ( TARGET.Disk >= DiskUsage ) && ( TARGET.FileSystemDomain == MY.FileSystemDomain )
